name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Belfast

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with my partner over the New Year weekend and would recommend it to anyone. This is an extremely modern and stylish hotel, not classical in anyway but very luxurious in a Scandinavian way.
reviews.title: Stylist, modern and lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is very impressive and the staff lovely and they could not do enough for you. The hotel was not over crowded so we got to enjoy the space and restaurant area without having lots of people in the way. The breakfast is definitely the best I have ever had in a UK hotel, in fact this is probably my favourite hotel out of anywhere I have ever stayed in the UK.
reviews.title: Great Stay
overall a great place to stay in belfast
reviews.text: Our room was lovely and the bathroom modern and fresh with fabulous toiletries and a bath big enough for two!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view was amazing and the bed really comfortable with a fab flat screen that is positioned on a rotational device.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing
Disappointed
reviews.text: I usually look for a Radisson whenever I’m away on business or pleasure, I like their funky-cool hotel design, laid-back (but attentive) staff and superb breakfasts, and a recent weekend trip to Belfast meant I was probably going to stay at the Radisson there. I checked this site, just to review what people on here have said, and from what I read I had no hesitation in booking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However – now for the bad news. I wouldn’t stay here again, nor could I recommend it for the following reasons.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, while the location could still be classed as ‘central’, the hotel is housed in a modern, uninspiring office block on a non-descript industrial park. Okay, there’s a glass lift and a small water feature, but apart from that – nothing. There’s no atmosphere, no buzz that you’re in one of the most exciting cities in the UK. Second – the food. Or should I say the breakfast. Last stay at a Rad was in Glasgow, and I suggest that the whole management team stay there for a weekend, just to get a gander at the breakfast. A truly memorable experience, the content, quality and massive selection is almost beyond belief. They also have a selection of organic items! They have Norwegian brown cheese, berries of all types, scooping yoghurt, etc. The breakfast at the Belfast Rad was pathetic in comparison. Third, our room – it was a suite in the tower – was still not serviced by 4pm, and I had to go to reception to get it done. We’d been out all day, was due at the theatre for 5, we were late, so that cheesed us off no end. Oh, and we arrived at 8pm. No offer to help with bags to the room. Loads of missing items in the room, like milk portions (again, Glasgow Rad offers a delivery of a pint of fresh milk first thing in the morning) and missing items from the minibar (for which I later found out we were charged for). The paper I ordered for the morning didn’t get chucked outside my door until 9am.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel - we'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an evening meal at Malmaison, and judging by the décor and staff, I will stay there next time for sure. Uber cool, funky and stylish, they seem to know what they’re doing.
